name: Optimize!
description:
Manao is solving a problem with the following statement: He came up with a
solution that produces the correct answers but is too slow. You are given the
pseudocode of his solution, where the function getAnswer calculates the answer
to the problem: getAnswer(a[1..n], b[1..len], h) answer = 0 for i = 1 to
n-len+1 answer = answer + f(a[i..i+len-1], b, h, 1) return answer f(s[1..len],
b[1..len], h, index) if index = len+1 then return 1 for i = 1 to len if
s[index] + b[i] >= h mem = b[i] b[i] = 0 res = f(s, b, h, index + 1) b[i] =
mem if res > 0 return 1 return 0 Your task is to help Manao optimize his
algorithm. Input The first line contains space-separated integers n, len and h
(1 ≤ len ≤ n ≤ 150000; 1 ≤ h ≤ 10^9). The second line contains len space-
separated integers b1, b2, ..., blen (1 ≤ bi ≤ 10^9). The third line contains
n space-separated integers a1, a2, ..., an (1 ≤ ai ≤ 10^9). Output Print a
single number — the answer to Manao's problem. Examples Input 5 2 10 5 3 1 8 5
5 7 Output 2
